name: Rustic Potato, Leek & Smoked Haddock Soup
recipeIngredient: 2 natural smoked haddock skin on bone in,
4 large leeks (harsh green removed, quarter and wash well, then sliced),
2 large potatoes (peeled and cut into 15mm chunks),
600ml light fish stock or vegetable stock,
recipeInstructions: 1. Place a couple of knobs of butter on the flesh side of each haddock add a splash of white wine, wrap each haddock in tin foil and place in a hot oven for five minutes,
2. Remove from oven and pick the fish clean of all skin and bone, keep warm and reserve any juices.
3. Melt the remaining butter then add bacon, onions, leeks and potatoes and sweat over a low heat for 10–15 minutes.
4. Add milk and stock and cook for a further 15 minutes. Stir in the cream and any reserved juices from the fish, bring back to the boil. The potatoes should be cooked by this stage.
5. Add flaked haddock and chopped parsley and season with pepper and nutmeg.
6. You may only need a little salt as the haddock can be quite salty. Assembly Ladle into bowls and swirl on some extra cream and chopped parsley, serve with hunks of soda bread.
